title: Thunderbird NOT showing numbers of emails in Junk and Spam folders`
content:
I have tried. Lord, how I've tried. to STOP Thunderbird, GMail (web), and Outlook (web) from putting ANY emails in Junk or Spam folders. Apparently, GMail and Outlook have "services" on their websites that mark things as JUNK before they ever get to me. I have turned OFF everything I can find in Thunderbird to stop stuff from going in JUNK/SPAM folders, but emails still get there.

Since I am apparently unable to STOP emails from going to JUNK/SPAM folders, it would be really helpful if Thunderbird showed little numbers as to how many emails are in there. It currently does NOT. Do I have something set incorrectly or is that a "feature" in Thunderbird?

Would appreciate any help.

Thank you.
creator: dalewebb1

title: Thunderbird fails to find my present email account.
content: Installing Thunderbird on a new iMac M4 with Sequoia 15..1.1 OS. Thunderbird says it "failed to find the setting of my email account." I entered the correct gmail user name and the correct password. Any idea on what might be wrong and how to fix it?
creator: kramsey999

title: Suddenly unable to receive POP3 email from sbcglobal.net
content: On Wednesday 12/11 at approx 4PM PT, Thunderbird stopped being able to log in to my sbcglobal.net POP3 account. It had been receiving emails routinely up to that time. There are two error messages associated with this. One happens if TB has been open and I ask it to download new messages using the little cloud symbol or “Get Messages”: “The account xxx@sbcglobal.net is being processed. Please wait until processing is complete to get messages.” Or if I open TB and it just starts with the login process, the error messages is a popup: “Connection to server inbound.att.net timed out.” TB manages two other accounts, both of which are functioning normally. One of them is also an sbcglobal.net account, and both sbcglobal accounts are set up identically: Port 995, SSL/TLS, Secure Mail Key (rather than OAuth2). Version is 115.18.0 32bit, Windows 22H2. Logging in to the server shows many emails that have arrived since the problem started. I have gotten nowhere with ATT/SBC, they don't seem to want to provide any support anymore if they hear the word Thunderbird. Can you help?
creator: JimFxSpt

title: Thunderbird won't send emails
content: I've had Tbird for a number of years and have been satisfied. However, this past year the program started to act up not sending emails every once in a while. Problem would clear itself in 2-3 days. Now it won't. I have not been able to send emails for three months. I have gone through all your advice in all your Support and all your info available on the internet. There is nothing wrong with my Tbird set up, my computer, or my ISP. It's a Tbird thing. I am not the only one who has this problem judging by the number of incidents in your support page. Please get this thing fixed because I am [this] close to uninstalling a now-useless program. Thank you.
creator: moleary3

title: Thunderbird Not Responding
content: This happened once before, then started working again for a few months and now doing it again. When I start up Thunderbird the emails will not load. I keeps saying "not responding." After around five minutes or so a couple of emails will load and then it's back to "not responding." Then another few or more minutes of waiting and another couple of emails download and back to "not responding." This goes on for hours. Tonight I have been waiting for eight hours and I'm still waiting with no end in sight. I can't do anything else with email until it finishes. This is very frustrating. Can you help?
creator: charleshrhyne

title: Mozilla support
content: Not a question, but an ANSWER. You could get double or triple the contributions, if you gave the users some kind of RECOGNITION! I've made several contributions over the years, and I've received zero acknowledgement. Why don't you software geniuses do some coding to RECOGNIZE THE PEOPLE WHO SUPPORT YOU. Make a little logo that pops up in the browser and email screens acknowledging the user as a "Supporter of Firefox/Thunderbird Software," ...or something like that. Go ahead! Make me feel just a little better every time I use your software. This is just an idea...from a retired old social psychologist. --Ed Mitchell [removed email]

title: Local folders fail to import
content: I have Thunderbird running successfully on an iMac (Intel), running Catalina 10.15.7. With Matt's help, I got Thunderbird running on a new iMac M4 running Sequoia 15.1.1. Emails are correct in the new Inbox, but the Local Folders from the old iMac are not duplicated on the new M4 iMac. Tried using the Import function in T-bird but it said that Import failed unexpectedly. Any ideas on what could be wrong? Thanks for any help you can offer.

title: Accesso al server imap.mail.me.com con nome utente XXX non riuscito
content: Da qualche giorno "solo sul PC" la posta riferita all'account sul server mail.me.com non si connette e restituisce l'errore in oggetto: "Accesso al server imap.mail.me.com con nome utente XXX non riuscito". title: Can't select Unified folders at all
content:
Thunderbird 128.5.2esr (64-bit)

Some weeks ago I was using Thunderbird normally. My setup: I have 5 accounts or so added to my thunderbird account. I had enabled "unified folders" view since it's more comfortable for me to do so. If i recall correctly i also disabled "all folders" view so i only see unified folders.

I don't recall exactly what triggered the bug I'm experiencing, but one day all Thunderbird rendered black, no folders, just the menu above, with the search bar and the buttons at top right.

I started the troubleshoot mode as per online recommendations and I don't know exactly what i did, but got my folders back, the only issue, is that "all folders" was enabled.

And now when i try to enable unified folders it does nothing, and if i enable/disable another view, the unified folders view gets disabled too.

See the video https://imgur.com/a/QuCzyZD

Is there a way to fix this?
creator: jai_mi_to

title: Gmail OAuth login "script terminated by timeout"
content:
I reinstalled thunderbird and cleared the profile folder. Then when I login Gmail, after the OAuth, it tells me "Unable to login at server. Possibly wrong configuration, username or password."

This only happens to Gmail. I also tried Outlook and this didn't happen.

I then tried running thunderbird in the terminal to see what it outputs: (image 2)

"line 232: Script terminated by timeout"

Technical information: TB version: 128.5.1-1 (arch linux aur)
creator: AdrianL40

title: Archiving marks messages as deleted
content:
Hi all,

has there been a recent change in Thunderbird's archiving behavior? Whenever I archive an email in Thunderbird, it only gets marked as deleted since a recent update (about 2-3 weeks ago). The emails then stay in the inbox until I fully delete them. Previously, moving an email to the archive would delete it from the inbox right away.

Is there any option to control this behavior? It makes my inbox quite messy - especially when on the go and already archived emails keep appearing in my inbox.

Many thanks in advance.
creator: eric.emmrich

title: Importazione in Thunderbird in formato mbox/Importing MBOX Files into Thunderbird
content:
Gentilissimi,

ho provato a scaricare le email inviate e le email ricevute in formato mbox (l'unico che mi viene data possibilità di scaricare) dal mio account PEC di Aruba per inserirlo su Thunderbird come archivio e svuotare la PEC. Tra l'altro sto facendo lo scarico dati di una email di GMAIL per eseguire la stessa operazione. Questa email l'ho anche inserita su Thunderbird per utilizzo quotidiano. Purtroppo non riesco ad eseguire l'importazione, anche se ho cercato di seguire tutti i passaggi. Sapreste darmi indicazioni su come procedere o se ci sono altri sistemi? Grazie

Cordialmente

DC


---

Dear All,

I attempted to download both sent and received emails in MBOX format (the only option available) from my Aruba PEC account to import them into Thunderbird as an archive and clear the PEC mailbox. Additionally, I am downloading data from a Gmail account to perform the same operation. I have already added this Gmail account to Thunderbird for daily use. Unfortunately, I am unable to complete the import process, even though I have tried to follow all the steps.

Could you provide guidance on how to proceed or suggest alternative methods? Thank you.

Best regards, DC
creator: compagnoni.campoformido
